page.title: 01VILLAGE OF BISHOPS LYDEARD
page.content: The first indication of settlement is a hoard of Roman coins found just south of the village. The first written evidence was in 904 when King Edward the Elder gave the village to his tutor,the then Bishop of Sherborne. The village expanded and changed since then in line with national social changes and events,however since the Second World War it has expanded out of all proportion now having 2153 adults on the Electoral Roll. The local administration is by the 15 elected members of the Parish Council. Despite the large influx of people,"old" and "new" villagers work as one to maintain an interesting and friendly community in which to live and grow.
